titleStmt.title: Vox regis, or, The difference betwixt a King ruling by law, and a tyrant by his own will with the excellency of the English laws, rights and priviledges : in two speeches of King James to the Parliaments in 1603 and March 21. 1609 : and in his basilicon doron : which may be an appendix to Vox Populi.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
